qas.question: When did Watch Tower supporters gather as autonomous congregations to study the Bible?
When did Russell visit each of the congregations to provide the format he recommended to conduct their meetings?
What did the congregations which continued to form during Russell's ministry remain?
Who presided over Zion's Watch Tower Tract Society in 1881?
Who was the most distributed Christian author in the world in 1912?
Who presided over Zion's Watch Tower Tract Society in 1900?
In what year did Charles Taze Russell die?
In what year did William Henry Conley die?
How many foreign missionaries did Charles Taze Russell appoint?

context: <a0_0>From 1879<a0_0/>, Watch Tower supporters gathered as autonomous congregations to study the Bible topically. <a1_0>Thirty<a1_0/> congregations were founded, and <a2_0>during 1879 and 1880<a2_0/>, Russell visited each to provide the format he recommended for conducting meetings. As congregations continued to form during Russell's ministry, they each remained <a3_0>self-administrative<a3_0/>, functioning under the congregationalist style of church governance. In 1881, Zion's Watch Tower Tract Society was presided over by <a4_0><b5_0><b6_0>William Henry Conley<b6_0/><b5_0/><a4_0/>, and in <b8_0>1884<b8_0/>, Charles Taze Russell incorporated the society as a non-profit business to distribute tracts and Bibles. By about 1900, Russell had organized <b9_0>thousands<b9_0/> of part- and full-time colporteurs, and was appointing foreign missionaries and establishing branch offices. By the 1910s, Russell's organization maintained nearly a hundred "pilgrims," or traveling preachers. Russell engaged in significant global publishing efforts during his ministry, and by <b7_0>1912<b7_0/>, he was the most distributed Christian author in the United States.
